intro: Hieracium recognitum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium recognitum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aggressive spreading habit.
